messages.message:
I tried searching for this error in slack but it isn't showing up. When I try to commit some changes to the following files I get a yapf error when committing on my local machine

Files:
`shared-utils/py-utils/solution-utils/src/py/instabase/solution_utils/deployed_solution_util.py`
`webserver/api-server/src/py/instabase/api_server_apps/handler/api/v2/solutions/deployed_solutions.py`

```yapf.....................................................................Failed
hookid: yapf

yapf: toml package is needed for using pyproject.toml as a configuration file```
Has anyone run into something similar?
So I also tried doing `pip install toml` but it's not resolving the issue as the requirement has already been satisfied

Can you try reverting your changes to .pre-commit-config.yaml? It looks like it may have been included in one of the commits (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/commit/9973ccfb671bbdf18204693937305fe0a8ec7e57#diff-63a9c44a44acf85fea213a857769990937107cf072831e1a26808cfde9d096b9) to the hack branch

can do `git checkout master .pre-commit-config.yaml`
This worked! Thanks for helping looking into this
